the act of biting or tearing with teeth.
a tooth or teeth.
either of the two fleshy folds that covers the teeth; a lip.

any crustacean of the order Decapoda, having ten legs, including the crabs, lobsters, crayfish, prawns, and shrimps; a decapod.
one tenth of state's revenue earmarked for repair and renovate water tanks, wells, canals, etc.
total land of a state earning that much of revenue as land-tax for the state.
the authority of the person, spending that much money for the purpose, to collect as tax one tenth of the produce (or its worth) got from land benefited.
tax paid or to be paid by the owners of the land that got benefited from such irrigation.
preceded by nine others in a continuous series; tenth; 10th.
designating any of the ten equal parts of a whole.
the tenth one in a continuous series.
(arith.) of or based on the number 10; decimal.
any of the ten equal parts of something.
(arith.) a fraction with an unwritten denominator of 10 or some power of 10, indicated by a point (decimal point) before the numerator; a decimal.
a period of ten years; a decade.
the tenth day following a new moon-day or full moon-day.
the period between the beginning of 91st year and the end of 100th year in the life of a person.
a kind of dry, flat cake made of the flour of jowar, wheat etc, mixed with milk.
a man in the tenth decade of his age, i.e. in between 91st year and 100th year.
collectively, ten kinds of medicinal herb.
a medicinal substance made using ten kinds of herbs.
a kind of cloth, offered to another as a mark of respect.

ten kinds of dramas.
one million; 10,00,000.
the first digit from left, in a seven digit number.

any of the ten equal parts of something.
(arith.) a fraction with an unwritten denominator of 10 or some power of 10, indicated by a point (decimal point) before the numerator; a decimal.
a man having good luck; a fortunate man.
a woman having good luck; a fortunate woman.
(myth.) collectively, the ten principal incarnations of Viṣṇu.
